meanings.sent1: I accidentally jiggered my phone screen by dropping it.
meanings.sent2: The storm jiggered the roof of the house, causing leaks.
meanings.sent3: I jiggered my chances of winning the game by making a silly mistake.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions jiggered the delicate balance of the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The artist's bold brushstrokes jiggered the peaceful scene into chaos.

meanings.definition: To be exhausted or worn out
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, I was completely jiggered.
meanings.sent2: She felt jiggered after staying up all night studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: I was so jiggered after the long hike that I fell asleep standing up.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine sounded jiggered and struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The tired marathon runner's legs were jiggered, but she pushed on to the finish line.

meanings.definition: A small measure of liquor, typically 1.5 ounces
meanings.sent1: The bartender poured a jiggered of whiskey into the cocktail.
meanings.sent2: She measured the vodka using a jiggered before mixing the drink.
meanings.sent3: The tiny jiggered of rum added just the right kick to the punch.
meanings.sent4: The jiggered of tequila in the margarita gave it the perfect flavor.
meanings.sent5: The bartender expertly poured the jiggered of gin, ensuring a balanced cocktail.
